alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Dyer; Haywood; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 4:20AM CST until February 16 at 7:30AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Crockett, Dyer, Gibson, Haywood, Henry, Lauderdale, Obion and Weakley. * WHEN...Until 730 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dyersburg, Martin, Ripley, Trenton, Newbern, Dresden, Dyer, Halls, Greenfield, Gleason, Kenton, Rutherford, Bradford, Sharon, Eaton, Chestnut Bluff, Bradleytown, Unionville, Forked Deer and Maury City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
